Kirsten Gillibrand previously sat on the House Armed Services Committee when she represented New York's 20 th District in the House. One of the reasons I came to Congress was to strengthen our national security and serve as a voice for our troops and military families, said Kirsten Gillibrand .`` I am honored to once again serve on the Armed Services Committee to continue fighting for America's troops and veterans.''

the Betty White House and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan. 28. California Treasurer Bill Lockyer told Reuters Insider Monday that states may not need the same freedom to declare bankruptcy as major companies because they have a guaranteed source of revenue. The major difference, of course, is that we're looking at sovereign governments that have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with, he said. Nicole Scherzinger and Cheryl Cole are also being considered for places on the judging panel, because they've got a proven track record of being great judges, but that doesn't rule Rihanna out.`` She has a massive appeal and a real edge to her, they added.`` Simon Cowell knows she wouldn't be afraid to give her opinion.'' Others who have been rumoured for the show's judging panel include Will Smith , Katy Perry , Mick Jagger and Mariah Carey .

scandal at one of Britain's sauciest tabloids. The aide, Andy Coulson , had edited News of the World, Britain's biggest-selling Sunday newspaper, until 2007 and shortly after was hired by David Cameron . Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, Andy Coulson said in a statement. The resignation is a blow for David Cameron who had repeatedly backed Andy Coulson against calls for his resignation, saying earlier this week that everyone deserved a`` second chance.''

Donald Rumsfeld , who served as President Bush 's defense chief for six years after holding the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives. But he had no regrets about his leadership for the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan- the latter now nearing its 10th anniversary.`` I think the world's a better place with Saddam Hussein gone
